file

Class SharedFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • file.SharedFile
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class SharedFile
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Description of SharedFile class:
    This class is used to represent in code level the files that a client in Fish Project can share from a local folder. It contains all the necessary details like name, size, extension etc.
    Since:
    Java 1.6 - 03 December 2012.
    Version:
    1.00a (Beta)
    Author:
    Georgios Paralykidis, Filippia Zikou
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      This method returns the ID of a SharedFile.

      This method returns the fileName of the SharedFile.

      This method returns the owner of the SharedFile.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SharedFile

        public SharedFile(int ID,
          java.lang.String fileName,
          java.lang.String extension,
          long size,
          java.lang.String owner)
        Parameters:
        ID - The unique ID of the file.
        fileName - The name of the file without the extension.
        extension - The extension of the file starting with "." (if file has one ).
        size - The size of the file in Bytes .
        owner - The name with which the client sharing the file registered when logging into the server.

    • Method Detail

      • getID

        public int getID()
        This method returns the ID of a SharedFile. If no ID exists for that file it returns null.
        Returns:
        ID - The unique ID of the file (e.g. 5), null if does not exist.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        This method returns the fileName of the SharedFile. If no fileName exists for that file it returns null.
        Returns:
        fileName - The name of the file without the extension (e.g. "document"), null if does not exist.

      • getExtension

        public java.lang.String getExtension()
        This method returns the extention of the SharedFile. If no extension exists for that file it returns null.
        Returns:
        extension - The extension (e.g.: ".txt") of the file. null if does not exist.

      • getSize

        public long getSize()
        This method returns the size of the SharedFile. If no size exists for that file it returns null.
        Returns:
        size - The size of the file (e.g. 500), null if does not exist.

      • getOwner

        public java.lang.String getOwner()
        This method returns the owner of the SharedFile. If no owner exists for that file it returns null.
        Returns:
        owner - The name with which the client sharing the file registered when logging into the server (e.g. "George"), null if does not exist.

      • isFile

        public boolean isFile()
        This method returns the "true" if target is a file. If not returns false
        Returns:
        true - If target is file. Else returns false.
